$comments: VSCode: apply for '*.schm.yaml' using this guide https://dev.to/brpaz/how-to-create-your-own-auto-completion-for-json-and-yaml-files-on-vs-code-with-the-help-of-json-schema-k1i
title: Unit
description: Schematics description in YAML format for unit

unitSpec.title: Unit Specification
unitSpec.description:
Contains unit specification:

  - declaration of IO,
  - declaration of unit's generics,
  - unit's attributes defaults,
  - description of unit's schematic

source.title: Source
source.description:
Path to external file with unit specification.
Path may be specified as:

  - locally referenced path,
  - absolute path (in respect to common base path),
  - http reference,
  - git reference (see docs for details).

A part of file can be used if specified so (extra path after # (hash) sign, similar to JSON-Schema).
Loaded data should be a dictionary.
Items from loaded data would override items that were declared ABOVE (items that are not in loaded data would be kept).
Loaded data can be altered then with declarations BELOW.

merge.title: Merge
merge.description:
List with unit specifications, that would be merged with items, declared ABOVE:
  - dictionaries are mixed recursively (existing items are replaced),
  - lists are joined,
  - scalars simply replaced,
  - items with null/None value would delete existing items.

Since specification allows 'source' - data for merge may be loaded from external file.

virtual.title: Virtual
virtual.description: Specification is used only for referencing from other places

nets.title: Nets
nets.description: Description of connections within this very unit

oneOf.title: Net Specification
oneOf.description:
Net specification in form of list of strings.
First two items are source and destination endpoints, following list items are net attributes and regex toggler.

additionalItems.title: Net attributes
additionalItems.description:
Attributes of net specified as string, or regex toggler.
Attributes are specified using following pattern: 'attr_name:attr_value', for example 'name:clk'.
If '-regex' within attributes then src and dst are treated as regexes.

unitsDict.title: Nested units
unitsDict.description:
Dictionary with specifications for nested units instances.
Key is unit's instance reference name, that would be used in nets, operators and other references.
Value should be an unit's instance specification.

unitInst.title: Unit's Instance Specification
unitInst.description:
Contains:

  - values for unit's generics,
  - locally referred connections and operators,
  - display specification,
  - attributes overrides

oneOf.title: Symbolic Reference to Unit Specification
oneOf.description:
Reference for Unit Specification lookup in external files.

Specified as:
  - path (same rules as for 'source' field),
  - just a filename without extension within angle braces (i.e. <>)

name.description:

If omitted then unit's reference name would be used

ioDict.title: IO subgroup
ioDict.description:
Used when multiple IO's are grouped into single IO group. Dictionary with specifications for each IO of a group.
Key is IO reference sub name. Subname would be joined with group's name via '.' (dot) and joined name would be used in nets, operators and other references.
Value should be an IO specification.
